verses.kjv: Then all the children of Israel went out, and the congregation was gathered together as one man, from Dan even to Beersheba, with the land of Gilead, unto the LORD in Mizpeh.
verses.web: Then all the children of Israel went out, and the congregation was assembled as one man, from Dan even to Beersheba, with the land of Gilead, to LORD at Mizpah.
verses.ct: Every Israelite came out, and the entire community assembled as one — from Dan in the north to Beersheba in the south, including those from Gilead east of the Jordan. They gathered before the LORD at Mizpah.

verses.kjv: And the chief of all the people, even of all the tribes of Israel, presented themselves in the assembly of the people of God, four hundred thousand footmen that drew sword.
verses.web: The chiefs of all the people, even of all the tribes of Israel, presented themselves in the assembly of the people of God, four hundred thousand footmen who drew sword.
verses.ct: The leaders of every tribe in Israel took their places in the assembly of God's people, along with 400,000 foot soldiers armed with swords.

verses.kjv: (Now the children of Benjamin heard that the children of Israel were gone up to Mizpeh.) Then said the children of Israel, Tell us, how was this wickedness?
verses.web: (Now the children of Benjamin heard that the children of Israel had gone up to Mizpah.) The children of Israel said, “Tell us, how did this wickedness happen?”
verses.ct: (The people of Benjamin heard that the rest of Israel had gathered at Mizpah.) The Israelites said, "Tell us — how did this terrible thing happen?"

verses.kjv: And the Levite, the husband of the woman that was slain, answered and said, I came into Gibeah that belongeth to Benjamin, I and my concubine, to lodge.
verses.web: The Levite, the husband of the woman who was murdered, answered, “I came into Gibeah that belongs to Benjamin, I and my concubine, to spend the night.
verses.ct: The Levite, the husband of the murdered woman, answered, "My concubine and I came to Gibeah in Benjamin's territory to spend the night.

verses.kjv: And the men of Gibeah rose against me, and beset the house round about upon me by night, and thought to have slain me: and my concubine have they forced, that she is dead.
verses.web: The men of Gibeah rose against me, and surrounded the house by night. They intended to kill me and they raped my concubine, and she is dead.
verses.ct: During the night, the men of Gibeah came after me. They surrounded the house, intending to kill me. Instead, they raped my concubine, and she died.

verses.kjv: And I took my concubine, and cut her in pieces, and sent her throughout all the country of the inheritance of Israel: for they have committed lewdness and folly in Israel.
verses.web: I took my concubine and cut her in pieces, and sent her throughout all the country of the inheritance of Israel; for they have committed lewdness and folly in Israel.
verses.ct: I took her body, cut it into pieces, and sent them throughout the entire land of Israel — because these men committed an unspeakable and disgusting act in Israel.

verses.kjv: Behold, ye are all children of Israel; give here your advice and counsel.
verses.web: Behold, you children of Israel, all of you, give here your advice and counsel.”
verses.ct: All of you are Israelites. Speak up — what do you think we should do?"

verses.kjv: And all the people arose as one man, saying, We will not any of us go to his tent, neither will we any of us turn into his house.
verses.web: All the people arose as one man, saying, “None of us will go to his tent, neither will any of us turn to his house.
verses.ct: The entire assembly rose as one and declared, "Not one of us will go home. No one will return to his house.

verses.kjv: But now this shall be the thing which we will do to Gibeah; we will go up by lot against it;
verses.web: But now this is the thing which we will do to Gibeah: we will go up against it by lot;
verses.ct: Here's what we'll do to Gibeah: we'll attack it, choosing who goes by casting lots.

verses.kjv: And we will take ten men of an hundred throughout all the tribes of Israel, and an hundred of a thousand, and a thousand out of ten thousand, to fetch victual for the people, that they may do, when they come to Gibeah of Benjamin, according to all the folly that they have wrought in Israel.
verses.web: and we will take ten men of one hundred throughout all the tribes of Israel, and one hundred of one thousand, and a thousand out of ten thousand to get food for the people, that they may do, when they come to Gibeah of Benjamin, according to all the folly that the men of Gibeah have done in Israel.”
verses.ct: We'll select 10 men out of every 100 from all the tribes of Israel, 100 out of every 1,000, and 1,000 out of every 10,000 to gather supplies for the army. Then the rest will march on Gibeah of Benjamin and repay them for the disgusting thing they did in Israel."

verses.kjv: So all the men of Israel were gathered against the city, knit together as one man.
verses.web: So all the men of Israel were gathered against the city, knit together as one man.
verses.ct: So all the men of Israel united against the city, bound together as one.

verses.kjv: And the tribes of Israel sent men through all the tribe of Benjamin, saying, What wickedness is this that is done among you?
verses.web: The tribes of Israel sent men through all the tribe of Benjamin, saying, “What wickedness is this that has happened among you?
verses.ct: The tribes of Israel sent messengers throughout the entire tribe of Benjamin, asking, "What is this terrible thing that happened among you?

verses.kjv: Now therefore deliver us the men, the children of Belial, which are in Gibeah, that we may put them to death, and put away evil from Israel. But the children of Benjamin would not hearken to the voice of their brethren the children of Israel:
verses.web: Now therefore deliver up the men, the wicked fellows who are in Gibeah, that we may put them to death and put away evil from Israel.” But Benjamin would not listen to the voice of their brothers, the children of Israel.
verses.ct: Hand over those worthless men in Gibeah so we can execute them and purge this evil from Israel." But the Benjaminites refused to listen to their fellow Israelites.

verses.kjv: But the children of Benjamin gathered themselves together out of the cities unto Gibeah, to go out to battle against the children of Israel.
verses.web: The children of Benjamin gathered themselves together out of the cities to Gibeah, to go out to battle against the children of Israel.
verses.ct: Instead, the Benjaminites gathered from their towns and assembled at Gibeah to go to war against the rest of Israel.

verses.kjv: And the children of Benjamin were numbered at that time out of the cities twenty and six thousand men that drew sword, beside the inhabitants of Gibeah, which were numbered seven hundred chosen men.
verses.web: The children of Benjamin were counted on that day out of the cities twenty-six thousand men who drew the sword, in addition to the inhabitants of Gibeah, who were counted seven hundred chosen men.
verses.ct: The Benjaminites mustered 26,000 swordsmen from their towns that day, plus 700 elite soldiers from Gibeah itself.

verses.kjv: Among all this people there were seven hundred chosen men lefthanded; every one could sling stones at an hair breadth, and not miss.
verses.web: Among all these soldiers there were seven hundred chosen men who were left-handed. Every one of them could sling a stone at a hair and not miss.
verses.ct: Among all these troops were 700 elite left-handed warriors, each one able to sling a stone at a hair's width and never miss.

verses.kjv: And the men of Israel, beside Benjamin, were numbered four hundred thousand men that drew sword: all these were men of war.
verses.web: The men of Israel, besides Benjamin, were counted four hundred thousand men who drew sword. All these were men of war.
verses.ct: The men of Israel, not counting Benjamin, numbered 400,000 swordsmen — all experienced fighters.

verses.kjv: And the children of Israel arose, and went up to the house of God, and asked counsel of God, and said, Which of us shall go up first to the battle against the children of Benjamin? And the LORD said, Judah shall go up first.
verses.web: The children of Israel arose, went up to Bethel, and asked counsel of God. They asked, “Who shall go up for us first to battle against the children of Benjamin?” LORD said, “Judah first.”
verses.ct: The Israelites went up to Bethel and asked God for direction. They said, "Which tribe should lead the attack against Benjamin?" The LORD answered, "Judah will go first."

verses.kjv: And the children of Israel rose up in the morning, and encamped against Gibeah.
verses.web: The children of Israel rose up in the morning and encamped against Gibeah.
verses.ct: The Israelites got up the next morning and set up camp near Gibeah.

verses.kjv: And the men of Israel went out to battle against Benjamin; and the men of Israel put themselves in array to fight against them at Gibeah.
verses.web: The men of Israel went out to battle against Benjamin; and the men of Israel set the battle in array against them at Gibeah.
verses.ct: The men of Israel marched out to fight Benjamin and took their battle positions against them at Gibeah.

verses.kjv: And the children of Benjamin came forth out of Gibeah, and destroyed down to the ground of the Israelites that day twenty and two thousand men.
verses.web: The children of Benjamin came out of Gibeah, and on that day destroyed twenty-two thousand of the Israelite men down to the ground.
verses.ct: But the Benjaminites charged out of Gibeah and cut down 22,000 Israelites that day.

verses.kjv: And the people the men of Israel encouraged themselves, and set their battle again in array in the place where they put themselves in array the first day.
verses.web: The people, the men of Israel, encouraged themselves, and set the battle again in array in the place where they set themselves in array the first day.
verses.ct: Despite this, the men of Israel rallied their courage and formed their battle lines again in the same place as the first day.

verses.kjv: (And the children of Israel went up and wept before the LORD until even, and asked counsel of the LORD, saying, Shall I go up again to battle against the children of Benjamin my brother? And the LORD said, Go up against him.)
verses.web: The children of Israel went up and wept before LORD until evening; and they asked of LORD, saying, “Shall I again draw near to battle against the children of Benjamin my brother?” LORD said, “Go up against him.”
verses.ct: (Before doing so, the Israelites went and wept before the LORD until evening. They asked the LORD, "Should we go fight our brother Benjamin again?" The LORD said, "Go up against him.")

verses.kjv: And the children of Israel came near against the children of Benjamin the second day.
verses.web: The children of Israel came near against the children of Benjamin the second day.
verses.ct: So the Israelites advanced against Benjamin on the second day.

verses.kjv: And Benjamin went forth against them out of Gibeah the second day, and destroyed down to the ground of the children of Israel again eighteen thousand men; all these drew the sword.
verses.web: Benjamin went out against them out of Gibeah the second day, and destroyed down to the ground of the children of Israel again eighteen thousand men. All these drew the sword.
verses.ct: Benjamin came out from Gibeah to meet them again on the second day and slaughtered another 18,000 Israelite swordsmen.

verses.kjv: Then all the children of Israel, and all the people, went up, and came unto the house of God, and wept, and sat there before the LORD, and fasted that day until even, and offered burnt offerings and peace offerings before the LORD.
verses.web: Then all the children of Israel and all the people went up, and came to Bethel, and wept, and sat there before LORD, and fasted that day until evening; then they offered burnt offerings and peace offerings before LORD.
verses.ct: Then all the Israelites — the entire army — went up to Bethel. They wept and sat before the LORD, fasting until evening. They offered burnt offerings and peace offerings to the LORD.

verses.kjv: And the children of Israel enquired of the LORD, (for the ark of the covenant of God was there in those days,
verses.web: The children of Israel asked LORD (for the ark of the covenant of God was there in those days,
verses.ct: The Israelites sought the LORD's guidance (for the ark of the covenant of God was there in those days,

verses.kjv: And Phinehas, the son of Eleazar, the son of Aaron, stood before it in those days,) saying, Shall I yet again go out to battle against the children of Benjamin my brother, or shall I cease? And the LORD said, Go up; for to morrow I will deliver them into thine hand.
verses.web: and Phinehas, the son of Eleazar, the son of Aaron, stood before it in those days), saying, “Shall I yet again go out to battle against the children of Benjamin my brother, or shall I cease?” LORD said, “Go up; for tomorrow I will deliver him into your hand.”
verses.ct: and Phinehas son of Eleazar, the grandson of Aaron, was serving before it). They asked, "Should we go out to battle against our brother Benjamin one more time, or should we stop?" The LORD answered, "Go up, because tomorrow I will hand them over to you."

verses.kjv: And Israel set liers in wait round about Gibeah.
verses.web: Israel set ambushes all around Gibeah.
verses.ct: So Israel positioned soldiers in ambush all around Gibeah.

verses.kjv: And the children of Israel went up against the children of Benjamin on the third day, and put themselves in array against Gibeah, as at other times.
verses.web: The children of Israel went up against the children of Benjamin on the third day, and set themselves in array against Gibeah, as at other times.
verses.ct: On the third day, the Israelites marched against Benjamin and took up their battle positions near Gibeah, just as they had before.

verses.kjv: And the children of Benjamin went out against the people, and were drawn away from the city; and they began to smite of the people, and kill, as at other times, in the highways, of which one goeth up to the house of God, and the other to Gibeah in the field, about thirty men of Israel.
verses.web: The children of Benjamin went out against the people, and were drawn away from the city; and they began to strike and kill of the people as at other times, in the highways, of which one goes up to Bethel and the other to Gibeah, in the field, about thirty men of Israel.
verses.ct: The Benjaminites rushed out to meet them and were drawn away from the city. They began striking down Israelites as before — killing about 30 men along the roads, one leading to Bethel and the other to Gibeah through the open country.

verses.kjv: And the children of Benjamin said, They are smitten down before us, as at the first. But the children of Israel said, Let us flee, and draw them from the city unto the highways.
verses.web: The children of Benjamin said, “They are struck down before us, as at the first.” But the children of Israel said, “Let’s flee, and draw them away from the city to the highways.”
verses.ct: The Benjaminites thought, "We're beating them just like before!" But the Israelites were saying to each other, "Fall back! Draw them away from the city and onto the roads."

verses.kjv: And all the men of Israel rose up out of their place, and put themselves in array at Baaltamar: and the liers in wait of Israel came forth out of their places, even out of the meadows of Gibeah.
verses.web: All the men of Israel rose up out of their place and set themselves in array at Baal Tamar. Then the ambushers of Israel broke out of their place, even out of Maareh Geba.
verses.ct: The main Israelite force pulled back from their positions and regrouped at Baal Tamar, while the Israelite ambush force burst out of their hiding place west of Gibeah.

verses.kjv: And there came against Gibeah ten thousand chosen men out of all Israel, and the battle was sore: but they knew not that evil was near them.
verses.web: Ten thousand chosen men out of all Israel came over against Gibeah, and the battle was severe; but they didn’t know that disaster was close to them.
verses.ct: Then 10,000 of Israel's best soldiers launched a head-on assault against Gibeah. The fighting was fierce, but the Benjaminites had no idea that disaster was closing in on them.

verses.kjv: And the LORD smote Benjamin before Israel: and the children of Israel destroyed of the Benjamites that day twenty and five thousand and an hundred men: all these drew the sword.
verses.web: LORD struck Benjamin before Israel; and the children of Israel destroyed of Benjamin that day twenty-five thousand one hundred men. All these drew the sword.
verses.ct: The LORD struck Benjamin down before Israel. That day the Israelites killed 25,100 Benjaminite swordsmen.

verses.kjv: So the children of Benjamin saw that they were smitten: for the men of Israel gave place to the Benjamites, because they trusted unto the liers in wait which they had set beside Gibeah.
verses.web: So the children of Benjamin saw that they were struck, for the men of Israel yielded to Benjamin because they trusted the ambushers whom they had set against Gibeah.
verses.ct: The Benjaminites finally realized they were defeated. The Israelite main force had given ground to Benjamin on purpose, because they were counting on the ambush they had set near Gibeah.

verses.kjv: And the liers in wait hasted, and rushed upon Gibeah; and the liers in wait drew themselves along, and smote all the city with the edge of the sword.
verses.web: The ambushers hurried, and rushed on Gibeah; then the ambushers spread out, and struck all the city with the edge of the sword.
verses.ct: The ambush force moved quickly, rushing into Gibeah. They spread out through the city and put everyone to the sword.

verses.kjv: Now there was an appointed sign between the men of Israel and the liers in wait, that they should make a great flame with smoke rise up out of the city.
verses.web: Now the appointed sign between the men of Israel and the ambushers was that they should make a great cloud of smoke rise up out of the city.
verses.ct: The Israelites and the ambush force had arranged a signal: when a huge column of smoke rose from the city, the main army would know it was time to turn and attack.

verses.kjv: And when the men of Israel retired in the battle, Benjamin began to smite and kill of the men of Israel about thirty persons: for they said, Surely they are smitten down before us, as in the first battle.
verses.web: The men of Israel turned in the battle, and Benjamin began to strike and kill of the men of Israel about thirty persons; for they said, “Surely they are struck down before us, as in the first battle.”
verses.ct: So when the Israelite main force initially retreated in battle and Benjamin had killed about 30 of them, the Benjaminites said, "We're crushing them just like the first battle!"

verses.kjv: But when the flame began to arise up out of the city with a pillar of smoke, the Benjamites looked behind them, and, behold, the flame of the city ascended up to heaven.
verses.web: But when the cloud began to arise up out of the city in a pillar of smoke, the Benjamites looked behind them; and behold, the whole city went up in smoke to the sky.
verses.ct: But then a massive column of smoke began rising from the city. The Benjaminites looked back and saw the entire city going up in flames toward the sky.

verses.kjv: And when the men of Israel turned again, the men of Benjamin were amazed: for they saw that evil was come upon them.
verses.web: The men of Israel turned, and the men of Benjamin were dismayed; for they saw that disaster had come on them.
verses.ct: At that moment, the Israelite main force turned and attacked. The men of Benjamin were terrified — they realized disaster had come upon them.

verses.kjv: Therefore they turned their backs before the men of Israel unto the way of the wilderness; but the battle overtook them; and them which came out of the cities they destroyed in the midst of them.
verses.web: Therefore they turned their backs before the men of Israel to the way of the wilderness, but the battle followed hard after them; and those who came out of the cities destroyed them in the middle of it.
verses.ct: They turned and ran from the Israelites toward the wilderness, but they couldn't escape the battle. Meanwhile, Israelites coming out of the captured towns cut them down from every side.

verses.kjv: Thus they inclosed the Benjamites round about, and chased them, and trode them down with ease over against Gibeah toward the sunrising.
verses.web: They surrounded the Benjamites, chased them, and trod them down at their resting place, as far as near Gibeah toward the sunrise.
verses.ct: They surrounded the Benjaminites, chased them down, and trampled them relentlessly, all the way past Gibeah toward the east.

verses.kjv: And there fell of Benjamin eighteen thousand men; all these were men of valour.
verses.web: Eighteen thousand men of Benjamin fell; all these were men of valor.
verses.ct: 18,000 Benjaminites fell in battle — all of them brave warriors.

verses.kjv: And they turned and fled toward the wilderness unto the rock of Rimmon: and they gleaned of them in the highways five thousand men; and pursued hard after them unto Gidom, and slew two thousand men of them.
verses.web: They turned and fled toward the wilderness to the rock of Rimmon. They gleaned five thousand men of them in the highways, and followed hard after them to Gidom, and struck two thousand men of them.
verses.ct: The survivors turned and fled toward the wilderness to the rock of Rimmon. The Israelites picked off 5,000 of them along the roads, then chased the rest as far as Gidom, killing another 2,000.

verses.kjv: So that all which fell that day of Benjamin were twenty and five thousand men that drew the sword; all these were men of valour.
verses.web: So that all who fell that day of Benjamin were twenty-five thousand men who drew the sword. All these were men of valor.
verses.ct: In total, 25,000 Benjaminite swordsmen fell that day — all of them brave warriors.

verses.kjv: But six hundred men turned and fled to the wilderness unto the rock Rimmon, and abode in the rock Rimmon four months.
verses.web: But six hundred men turned and fled toward the wilderness to the rock of Rimmon, and stayed in the rock of Rimmon four months.
verses.ct: But 600 men managed to escape. They fled into the wilderness to the rock of Rimmon, where they stayed for 4 months.

verses.kjv: And the men of Israel turned again upon the children of Benjamin, and smote them with the edge of the sword, as well the men of every city, as the beast, and all that came to hand: also they set on fire all the cities that they came to.
verses.web: The men of Israel turned again on the children of Benjamin, and struck them with the edge of the sword—including the entire city, the livestock, and all that they found. Moreover they set all the cities which they found on fire.
verses.ct: The Israelites then turned back against the rest of Benjamin's territory, putting everyone to the sword — men, women, livestock, and everything they found. They also burned down every town they came across.
